title: Slow Cooker Italian Beef Recipe
description: This Italian beef is perfect for sandwiches and easy to make in a slow cooker to guarantee the most tender and juicy results. So simple, yet so tasty!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Everyday Cooking Slow Cooker Main Dishes Beef Slow Cooker Italian Beef 4.6 (2,708) 1,933 Reviews 120 Photos This Italian beef is perfect for sandwiches. It's easy to make in a slow cooker and tastes just like my all-time favorite sandwich that I used to get at a local restaurant when I lived in a suburb of Chicago. Serve on crusty rolls with roasted sweet or hot peppers. Submitted by MAUREENBURR Updated on October 29, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 120 120 120 120 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 4 hrs 5 mins Total Time: 4 hrs 15 mins Servings: 10 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings 3 cups water 1 (.7 ounce) package dry Italian-style salad dressing mix 1 teaspoon dried oregano 1 teaspoon dried basil 1 teaspoon dried parsley 1 teaspoon onion salt 1 teaspoon garlic powder 1 bay leaf 1 teaspoon salt 1 teaspoon ground black pepper 1 (5 pound) rump roast Directions Combine water, salad dressing mix, oregano, basil, parsley, onion salt, garlic powder, bay leaf, salt, and black pepper in a saucepan. Stir well, and bring to a boil. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place rump roast in a slow cooker; pour hot herb mixture over the meat. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cover and cook on Low for 10 to 12 hours, or on High for 4 to 5 hours. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Remove bay leaf; shred beef with a fork and serve with some of the hot gravy. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 3,376 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 318 Calories 16g Fat 2g Carbs 39g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 10 Calories 318 % Daily Value * Total Fat 16g 20% Saturated Fat 6g 28% Cholesterol 100mg 33% Sodium 819mg 36% Total Carbohydrate 2g 1% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 1g Protein 39g 79% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 17mg 1% Iron 3mg 18% Potassium 530mg 11% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Slow Cooker Italian Beef 01 of 120 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 120 Photo by  SpryChive1924 01/21/2024 Easy to make, all the ingredients were in my pantry, the flavor is fabulous. I used onion powder instead of onion salt and it still tasted perfect. Six of us ate big sandwiches and there was still plenty leftover. 03 of 120 Photo by  DizzyDish6309 09/24/2023 I have made this a dozen times and it is wonderful! I made a few tweaks; I add a cup of red wine which helps dissolve the connective tissue of the top round greater. I add four beef bouillon cubes to four cups of beef broth to intensify the flavor. I use white pepper and one tablespoon of Italian herbs (along with the packet). Cook on high for 3 hours and then low for 5. I also keep the fat cap on for extra flavor throughout (I’ll see if I can add an after picture when finished) 04 of 120 Photo by  Loves2cook 07/03/2023 Loves 2CookNew it would be a fantastic recipe. It was a huge hit and will be in the top of our rotation for the family and when friends come over. We followed the recipe in the crockpot on low for 12 hours. It was so moist and flavorful everyone LOVED it. What little was left over the next day was even tastier. You know some things are always better after setting overnight. But if we tried that I don’t think it would make it through the nite because once it would be found it be devoured. ITS JUST THAT GOOD! We used Ciabatta rolls to made sandwiches. After pouring the hot herb mixture over the meat we added 1/2 of the juice from a 12 oz jar of sliced Pepperoncini’s. Then at the 10 hour mark we added 1/2 the jar of sliced Pepperoncini’s as well as 2 sliced Red Bell Peppers and 8 oz of sliced Mushrooms. THANK YOU MAUREEN for sharing this fantastic recipe. 05 of 120 Photo by  JoyfulGrape8696 11/29/2022 I made this recipe for the first time. I read most the comments and used the advice given! My rump roast was probably just under 3lbs,I used 3 cups of Beef Broth, 1 cup of Water, I use 2 beef bullion cubes, I DOUBLED all the seasonings, omitted the salt! I used Onion Powder instead of Onion Salt! I added a pinch of red pepper flakes for some added heat. I didn’t have a Bay leaf so it was omitted! I added a chopped white onion, a 12oz jar of Italian seasoned pepperoncinis! I slow cooked it all for about 9 hours. I then took it out and shredded the beef and sliced the pepperoncinis. Added it all back to the crock pot and slow cooked it for another 2 hours before separating the beef from the broth to chill overnight! I’ll skim the fat off the broth in the morning, add a few green peppers and slow cook to heat it up for another 2 hours! This is bursting with Flavor!! OMG 06 of 120 Photo by  Linda P 04/11/2021 Adjusted per others, cooked on low overnight, shredded and cooked on low for another 11/2 hours. Added provolone cheese and some diced jalapeños - under the broiler for a few minutes and we loved it! 07 of 120 Photo by  Charisma138 03/28/2021 Very good, but my personal preference is a Philly Cheesesteak, so i likely wouldn’t make it again. 08 of 120 Photo by  Danielle J Perron 02/23/2021 09 of 120 Photo by  luckysiu 01/13/2021 10 of 120 Photo by  Tara Gray 12/29/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Italian Beef Sandwiches 103 Ratings Loosemeat Sandwiches II 31 Ratings Hearty Meatball Sandwich 204 Ratings Bologna Salad Sandwich Spread 72 Ratings Sandwich Spread 40 Ratings Jibarito 26 Ratings Gyros Burgers 295 Ratings Oven-Baked Beef Tagliata 4 Ratings Reuben Sandwich 724 Ratings Homestyle Kalua Pork with Cabbage in a Slow Cooker 152 Ratings Easy Slow Cooker Italian Beef 197 Ratings Mock Sliders 5 Ratings The Best Meatballs 1,666 Ratings Slow Roasted BBQ Beef Roast 22 Ratings Easy North Carolina Barbeque 46 Ratings Red Wine Flavored Beef 94 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: MAUREENBURR
instructions: Combine water, salad dressing mix, oregano, basil, parsley, onion salt, garlic powder, bay leaf, salt, and black pepper in a saucepan. Stir well, and bring to a boil. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Place rump roast in a slow cooker; pour hot herb mixture over the meat. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Cover and cook on Low for 10 to 12 hours, or on High for 4 to 5 hours. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Remove bay leaf; shred beef with a fork and serve with some of the hot gravy. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
